item.title: [SAM-2342] extended matching type seems inaccessible
item.description: We had to fix the normal matching type a couple of years ago because it was not accessible. If you're using a screen reader or some other technology that doesn't let you see the whole screen at a glance, you have to memorize the possible answers or find yourself going back and forth between the two sections of the question. I strongly suggest that instead of blanks, you provide a pulldown list with all the answers, including either the whole text or a summary of it. For a newly designed question type, I'd expect that the instructor would be given the option of providing a summary if the text is two long for a pulldown menu.
item.summary: extended matching type seems inaccessible

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: I can give you a patch if you're interested.
I'd be interested in seeing the patch. It is a complex question type with some options that would be inaccessible by virtue of content as well, e.g. a labelled image can be used as the option list.
Charles' suggestion makes sense. Is there a patch available?

Just as a note, until there is a patch, if a11y is a big deal for this question you can disable the question type from being available.

samigo.question.show.extendedmatchingitems=false

The form items should at least have labels.

There can be multiple responses for each "answer option" so a drop down list might be difficult to make functional. Better (any) labels and access keys to jump back to a (better marked-up) possible answers table might go a long way.
Some eyes closed testing with Chromevox http://www.screencast.com/t/NNjakvHmg4I

Hmmm. Cognitive load indeed.

Ideally the choices should be structurally and visually side by side. See 1.png. The label would be the items in the first column ("XXX matches").

This is made complicated by the fact that the items in the first column can be anything. A string, markup with embedded whatnot See 2.png. The blobs on the left function as a label (clicking on them activates the correlate control) but how useful would a label be that can be theoretically as large as a popular Wikipedia entry?

How useful would it be if the <option> had a aria-describedby or (aria-labelledBy) tied to the corresponding item? For example:

<p id="choice1">A. Choice 1</p>
.................

<select>
<option aria-describedby="choice1">A</option>
.................

Not saying this would be possible since this is JSF, but maybe it would help?

A last resort would be to instrument it client-side post render to tie things together as needed. Something like [1] with Mneme but less extreme, like adding the describedBy/labelledBy for example.

[1] http://www-personal.umich.edu/~gsilver/testcenter-m/

item.title: [SAK-29042] Tables should be avoided for layout or at least have ARIA role Presentation
item.description:
The main/summary page of Forums tool uses a number of tables for layout; including nested tables. This could be better laid out as a list or other alternative (and less complex) block elements.

The simplest resolution is to add to each <table> the ARIA property:
role="presentation

Some more info about this role http://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria/roles#presentation
item.summary: Tables should be avoided for layout or at least have ARIA role Presentation

status.description: Issue has been created but has not yet been reviewed and validated, should not be worked on yet

item.title: [SAK-29358] Gradebook API throws NullPointerException
item.description:
The following Gradebook EntityBroker API throws a NPE for some sites:
/direct/grades/gradebook/SITEID.json

We're still trying to track down the root cause. The following GradebookServiceHibernateImpl:1261 maps to line 1234 in the current github master.

Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.sakaiproject.component.gradebook.GradebookServiceHibernateImpl.getTotalPointsEarnedInternal(GradebookServiceHibernateImpl.java:1261)
at org.sakaiproject.component.gradebook.GradebookServiceHibernateImpl.access$300(GradebookServiceHibernateImpl.java:84)
at org.sakaiproject.component.gradebook.GradebookServiceHibernateImpl$15.doInHibernate(GradebookServiceHibernateImpl.java:1029)
at org.springframework.orm.hibernate3.HibernateTemplate.doExecute(HibernateTemplate.java:419)

See comments below for more information and analysis.
item.summary: Gradebook API throws NullPointerException

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: Dave - can you verify the analysis by trying to reproduce on a local database? Thanks!

This is a proof of concept patch to avoid the null Boolean issue. It does not address all the uses of potentially null Booleans.

Index: gradebook-service/impl/src/java/org/sakaiproject/component/gradebook/GradebookServiceHibernateImpl.java
===================================================================
— gradebook-service/impl/src/java/org/sakaiproject/component/gradebook/GradebookServiceHibernateImpl.java (revision 312741)
+++ gradebook-service/impl/src/java/org/sakaiproject/component/gradebook/GradebookServiceHibernateImpl.java (working copy)
@@ -1082,12 +1082,14 @@
List<AssignmentGradeRecord> countedGradeRecs = new ArrayList<AssignmentGradeRecord>();
for (AssignmentGradeRecord gradeRec : studentGradeRecs) {
Assignment assign = gradeRec.getAssignment();

  • boolean extraCredit = assign.isExtraCredit();
    + Boolean extraCredit = assign.isExtraCredit();
    + logger.info("extraCredit: :"+ extraCredit);
    if(gradebook.getCategory_type() != GradebookService.CATEGORY_TYPE_NO_CATEGORY && assign.getCategory() != null && assign.getCategory().isExtraCredit() != null && assign.getCategory().isExtraCredit())
    extraCredit = true;

if (assign.isCounted() && !assign.getUngraded() && !assign.isRemoved() && countedSet.contains(assign) &&

  • assign.getPointsPossible() != null && assign.getPointsPossible() > 0 && !gradeRec.getDroppedFromGrade() && !extraCredit) {
    + //assign.getPointsPossible() != null && assign.getPointsPossible() > 0 && !gradeRec.getDroppedFromGrade() && extraCredit != null && !extraCredit)
    Unknown macro: {+ assign.getPointsPossible() != null && assign.getPointsPossible() > 0 && !gradeRec.getDroppedFromGrade() && Boolean.TRUE.equals(extraCredit)) { countedGradeRecs.add(gradeRec); } }

The table containing the problematic null values is GB_GRADABLE_OBJECT_T. The column that was tested was IS_EXTRA_CREDIT. Other nullable columns that are treated as booleans might also have this problem.

ANALYSIS

In Sakai 2.9 this has also been observed at line 1085. On both lines the value of an Assignment isExtraCredit field is being tested. The isExtraCredit value is defined as a Boolean object, not a primitive boolean. It therefore may be true, or false, or null. Having an null value in the isExtraCredit field based on GB_GRADEABLE_OBJECT_T would explain the null pointer exception. In the UMich CTools instance about 60% of the gb_gradable_object_t table rows have a null value. If Hibernate maps the null value in the db table to a null for the isExtraCredit field that would be consistent with this problem. The issue can arise anytime a method returns a Boolean object that may be null.

From here on I assume this is the problem. While most grade records store null as the extra credit value in the database the issue doesn't appear often. That makes it difficult to predict how wide spread the problem will be if the json feeds where this does happen start being used frequently for content migration.
There are multiple plausible but untested (and perhaps incorrect) approaches to this issue:

  • Enforce that there is a Boolean object.
    • This might be done by configuring Hibernate to always return a Boolean for this field even if the value is null.
    • Convert all Boolean to boolean in the Assignment object.
    • Update the field value directly in the database to ensure that there are no null values. This approach would not assure that no null values are put in the field in the future.
  • Safe checking of the current value.
    • Do a null check on the existence of the Boolean before checking its value.
    • Construct tests differently using code such as "Boolean.TRUE.equals(value)" or the Apache BooleanUtils that don't assume that value is non-null.

The issue has been confirmed. The value of GB_GRADABLE_OBJECT_T.IS_EXTRA_CREDIT may be null. Callers of isExtraCredit getter from the Assignments class may receive a null value as the Boolean object. Autoboxing to "boolean" value in the caller will fail if a null is returned. If the value is based on a database value from a column that allows null values a null could be returned. Addressing the exact issue found (near line 1085) required changes only to GradebookServiceHibernateImpl. The internal value of extraCredit was changed from boolean to Boolean. The test of extraCredit was changed to use the test "Boolean.TRUE.equals(extraCredit)". This works even for null values of extraCredit.

Other lines that should be investigated in GradebookServiceHibernateImpl are near 1091 and 1263. Calls to the boolean getters in the Category class should be checked as some of them also return Boolean objects and are used in GradeBookServiceHibernateImpl.

Verified the workaround with the following SQL:

update GB_GRADABLE_OBJECT_T set IS_EXTRA_CREDIT = 0
WHERE IS_EXTRA_CREDIT IS NULL AND GRADEBOOK_ID IN
(select ID from GB_GRADEBOOK_T WHERE GRADEBOOK_UID = 'SITE-ID')

item.title: [GOOGLE-161] Document known behaviors that may cause user confusion
item.description:
We need to document known behaviors that may cause confusion to end users.
Currently know examples:
1. Search results only match against the start of words. i.e. if I have a folder named "my testfest" and I search for "fest", the folder will not be returned. But if I search for "test", it will.

2. Expanding search results do not display subfolders unless they also match search results.
Scenario:
Instructor has complex directory structure
Several nested layers deep they know they have a directory names photos and that within that directory is another directory that they want to share with their course.

They search for 'photos' and their directory is returned. Excellent. Now they expand that directory so they can figure out the name of the sub-directory they wanted to share.

If they expand that folder, nothing is shown (because it doesn't match the search results).
item.summary: Document known behaviors that may cause user confusion

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

item.title: [QUALTRICS-253] Qualtrics must run in a clustered environment
item.description:
Production Qualtrics will be deployed to a clustered environment - we need to make sure there are no dependencies that will prevent this.

Here's an explanation of the problem and proposed solutions.

UI - The UI makes some direct Qualtrics calls to get data for a particular user. E.g. user information, the list of surveys available to this user, information about the linked or available surveys. Because of the same origin browser restriction and because we don't make the user token visible in the UI these requests all go through the proxy. A servlet "token" filter intercepts the request to the proxy and adds the real user token. For technical reasons the real user token will only be available on the LTI server to which the user is connected but since this query came from the browser it should have the load balancer cookie set to the appropriate back end server.

BACKEND - Some qualtrics API calls require information that is available via LTI but not available to the browser. Therefore the backend servlet constructs and runs some Qualtrics API requests directly. E.g. the backend can supply the list of the users in the current site. These calls use the proxy but since they are originated in the LTI servlet itself they have no attached load balancer cookies. This means that they may end up at any active LTI server and therefore are open to failure when there are multiple servers most of which do not have the correct token information.

Possible solutions are:
A) Add the load balancer cookie to the backend queries so they go to the right server. The cookie would need to be copied from some other query that was sent to the servlet.
B) Make sure that the API requests from the servlet somehow are directed to the localhost so that they run on the server where the information is available.
C) Finesse the proxy and "token" filter and have the servlet provide the correct token explicitly if available. This should work since the back end will build the query on the server where the token is stored.
D) Store the token somewhere available in all the cluster servers. There are multiple ways to do this.

B is good solution, though I have has trouble implementing it before.
C would be a simple and easy short term approach. It is specific to this problem but is easy to implement.
IHMO D is a better approach for the future. It can be simple and more general but will require some work to implement properly the first time.
item.summary: Qualtrics must run in a clustered environment

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: Qualtrics is currently running in a cluster environment.
Re-opening since distributing Qualtrics surveys does not work in a clustered environment.

The Qualtrics LTI servlet appears to consistently work in a clustered environment up through v3.0. The v3.1 version fails, and has changes to the lombok version and the lti-utils version. Dave's updated description is in response to this v3.1 failure, which is accompanied by the following errors in the logs:

item.title: [QUALTRICS-259] List of all student names and emails and recipientIDs should not be revealed to any one student
item.description:
As shown in attached screenshot, API calls currently result in visibility of course roster for individual student using Chrome developer tools in conjunction with loading the Qualtrics LTI tool where an instructor previously distributed surveys

Revealing course roster is a FERPA issue
Revealing recipient ID would enable a student to substitute another recipient ID and complete a survey on another student's behalf. In addition if the recipient had already completed the survey the student could potentially see his/her responses.
item.summary: List of all student names and emails and recipientIDs should not be revealed to any one student

item.title: [SAK-29372] Update Sakai LTI provider to optionally trust LTI Consumer's email as userid
item.description:
If an LTI Consumer and Provider share the same SSO, it should be possible for them to share the same userid. Some consumers only share the internal userid with the provider, which may not be the same as the SSO userid.

This enhancement will update the Sakai LTI provider to optionally 'trust' the consumer and lookup the userid based on the consumer provided user email. This will allow better integration between LTI providers and consumers.

Configuring this option will parallel the "basiclti.provider.highly.trusted.consumers" value in sakai.properties, by creating a new property "basiclti.provider.email.trusted.consumers", which also needs to match the value used to specify the provider key and secret.
item.summary: Update Sakai LTI provider to optionally trust LTI Consumer's email as userid

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [SAK-29547] Owners/Instructors are unable to access permissions for individual Resources folders
item.description:
Owners/Instructors are no longer able to see the Edit Folder Permissions in the Actions menus of any Resources folders (screenshot). This functionality is frequently used by instructors to give the Student role the ability to upload content to a given folder.

Admins are able to see the entry in the drop-down list and make changes. Making someone an admin allows them to see the item, removing them from admin removes the item.
All Resources perms are selected, both on the site and in Realms.
Looking in Sites, nothing in the tool itself seems to be incorrect.
No relevant entries in the Sakai.properties file.
The Edit Folder Permissions item is missing from old (2006) sites and newly created sites.
Seems to be a permissions issue but since ALL perms are assigned it is more likely the result of a change to the code.

Ref: INC0453997
item.summary: Owners/Instructors are unable to access permissions for individual Resources folders

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

item.title: [UMICH-1136] Update Ctools to use Java 8
item.description:
Java 7 will no longer provide critical bug fixes except through paid support in April 2015: http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/eol-135779.html

We need to update CTools to be compatible with Java 8:
http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/8-compatibility-guide-2156366.html

See SAK-25903
item.summary: Update Ctools to use Java 8

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment:
A number of the traditional JAVA_OPTS will be obsolete in JVM 8. PermSize / MaxPermSIze is ignored. Some others were added for other JVM transitions. E.g. "-Dsun.lang.ClassLoader.allowArraySyntax=true -Dorg.apache.jasper.compiler.Parser.STRICT_QUOTE_ESCAPING=false"

The options should be reconsidered since there is no point in passing ones that are ignored or are now unnecessary.
OSP and metaobj projects need to be removed from the build as part of this update.

I'd suggest the following approach:

1. Try to merge many or all patches described by SAK-25903 using Java 7
2. Be careful not to apply any changes related to database connection pool changes (e.g. KNL-1318)
3. Start with removing OSP & metaobj from the build (update pom.xml, master/pom.xml), compile & verify CTools boots
4. Next:, merge, compile & test each change individually – trying to build & run with Java 7 (hopefully many or all are backward compatible). Each patch should be committed to SVN separately.
5. Update to Java 8, apply any patches that didn't work with Java 7 (if any)
6. Run a clean compile and execute CTools with Java 8

Few things to note after the upgrading ctools to java 8

1) Gradebook is not launching. This is the Exception seen in Ctools UI.

org.sakaiproject.portal.api.PortalHandlerException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unable to find registered context for tool with ID sakai.gradebook.tool
at org.sakaiproject.portal.charon.SkinnableCharonPortal.doGet(SkinnableCharonPortal.java:894)
caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unable to find registered context for tool with ID sakai.gradebook.tool

2) Dashboard module is commented from root `pom.xml`, compiled fine but could not start tomcat if it was part of the build. produced below exception

item.title: [UMICH-1158] Determine correct JAVA_OPTS for Java 8 runtime
item.description:
Oracle did away with PermGen and replaced it with something called "Metaspace". Interestingly enough, Metaspace - unlike PermGen - has a maximum default of UNLIMITED if not defined. While this can be useful in some cases, it can lead to eating the servers memory by problematic apps. Also interestingly enough, in most cases, configuration can simply replace -XX:MaxPermSize=###M with -XX:MaxMetaspaceSize=###M and -XX:PermSize=###M with -XXMetaspaceSize=###M which would have the benefit of restraining this size to reasonable limits, preventing memory overload. This is useful since Metaspace has a MinMetaspaceFreeRatio and MaxMetaspaceFreeRatio which are set to "reasonable" limits based on the Maximum metaspace allowable, so by setting MaxMetaspaceSize, you're doing the memory manager a favor by causing Java to set a more reasonable GC trigger. Since Metaspace is under GC control already, nothing special is needed to enable GC, as was NOT the case under PermGen since it was not GC-enabled unless we added either CMSPermGenSweepingEnabled and/or CMSClassUnloadingEnabled flags depending on the version of Java.

The following permissions should be reviewed to see if they are still required:
-Dsun.lang.ClassLoader.allowArraySyntax=true
-Dorg.apache.jasper.compiler.Parser.STRICT_QUOTE_ESCAPING=false
item.summary: Determine correct JAVA_OPTS for Java 8 runtime

item.title: [UMICH-1160] Modify Gateway Login to provide user access to CTools, Canvas and Dash
item.description:
The Gateway login should be modified such that users can directly access CTools, Canvas or Dash. Some ideas:

  • a drop-down that allows the user three options
  • Three login buttons
  • Other options are welcomed...

As indicated by the comments below, we may have the context of their request, which would allow promotion of the dropdown option that a user is coming from. For instance, if coming from canvas.umich.edu, the 'Login to Canvas' option may be the highest priority.
item.summary: Modify Gateway Login to provide user access to CTools, Canvas and Dash

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: Cathy and I will be working with Rachael of the web design team to develop the best solution for this. Likely we will want at least two login buttons, one for ctools and one for Canvas. Still to be determined is whether we also want a separate login button for Latte. I will update this jira once that has been determined.
There are three login buttons at the moment (two which work and one which does not) – we can change the top CTools login button to consistently login to CTools.

We have a reported case where a user receives a 404 error when navigating to ctools.umich.edu. and clicks on the login button. He is not navigating to canvas.umich.edu. Here are his comments:

Hope this helps:

The login button appears to go to:

https://www.ctools.umich.edu/portal/login

which causes the behavior. It redirects to cosign:

https://weblogin.umich.edu/?cosign-ctools&https://www.ctools.umich.edu/sakai-login-tool/container

when cosign is done, I believe this means it should redirect to:

https://www.ctools.umich.edu/sakai-login-tool/container

but if you visit that page you get a 404. Which appears to use a 404 error handler, invalid.html, NOT for ctools.umich.edu, but weblogin.umich.edu (see screencap).

Some other possibilities:

1. Detect where they came from, present with link (and link anchor text) to where they meant to go.

Negatives:

a. the gateway is for CTools. If we present only a login link to Canvas there will cognitive dissonance.
b. a bit complicated and feels like trickery

2. Present with links to go to the two places

Negatives:

Busy - see screenshot (lotsoflogins.png)

In any case - it may be a good idea to turn the whole login box into an editable box via the gatewayadmin site resources. Very little work.
If 2 above, we may consider editing out the buttons in the boxes below (via gatewayadmin resources)

For 2 above, we may consider adding the text "Login in To:" next to the block M outside of the button. Present a button for "CTools" and next to it or below it for "Canvas".

We also talked about having a drop-down for the button with links for CTools, Canvas and Dash. That would require 2 clicks from the user. Ideally, we want to make it as easy as possible for students to login to Dash.

http://screencast.com/t/qTymwtdOQg

This remains an issue with Firefox on the mac (v24.4). It does not appear to be an issue in v27 of FF on windows. I cannot reproduce the problem in IE 11 or IE8 in Windows.

I'm assigning this to Margaret to add as an FAQ in the documentation for GCalendar.

item.title: [TLPORTAL-60] Dashboard should log response time data for input and output requests
item.description:
To support performance diagnosis during load testing, the rate and response times for Dashboard requests to the ESB should be available for reporting. This will essentially isolate performance of the Dashboard from the rest of the stack. Inbound requests to the Dashboard would also be useful for isolating the application from the load generation infrastructure.

This can be done by adding logging information to the Dashboard, obtaining the data from Splunk, a combination of the two, or some other method.

Request status code should also be recorded.
item.summary: Dashboard should log response time data for input and output requests

comments.comment: Information could be retrieved from splunk - but difficult to get accurate data from splunk due to learning curve
Based on data Dave has been displaying, the output request response times are being logged. Are the input response times as well?

Overall response time per request url is logged as well as time for the for ESB to respond to requests. Time logged for ESB requests includes response parsing. The time attributed to the ESB should only include the ESB call.

item.title: [TLPORTAL-79] Handle ESB throttling
item.description:
The Student Dashboard should detect and respond to ESB throttling behavior. The backend will report a throttling messages as an error to the UI.

The HTTP status code returned from the ESB for throttling is 503. The body returned is:

<amt:fault xmlns:amt="http://wso2.org/apimanager/throttling"><amt:code>900800</amt:code><amt:message>Message Throttled Out</amt:message><amt:description>You have exceeded your quota</amt:description></amt:fault>

This message may be available as JSON at some point.
item.summary: Handle ESB throttling

comments.comment: Throttling may not be currently implemented and in either case this will be handled as a generic error
If the user gets a valid error page and the error is logged, then no additional work is needed (especially since no throttling is currently expected)

item.title: [TLPORTAL-119] Add additional information to security.yml
item.description:
Add the session_secret to the security.yml and implement it's usage.

For example add the following lines. The key perhaps should be a random number but make sure that works in a cluster.

enable :sessions
set :session_secret, 'This is my special key'
item.summary: Add additional information to security.yml

item.title: [TLPORTAL-145] Consistent logging for Latte Ruby code
item.description:
Logging for the Latte ruby code should be easy to explain and configure. Issues to address are:
- Logging from the ruby code is sent to the sinatra.log file. This is inconvenient when running as a webapp. Logging should be sent to existing Tomcat logging files.
- Log level for automated tests should be settable in the test script.
- Log level for Latte code running as an application should be settable in one clearly documented location. Ideally this will be read from a configuration file.
- All requests to external services should be logged at least at the debug level.
- All error responses from external services should be recorded and logged.

TESTPLAN
- run latte as webapp and log statements will all appear in the normal tomcat logs.
- run latte standalone and log statements will appear in sinatra.log.
- in both cases can modify log level from StudentDashboard configuration file.
- Log level for test scripts can be set from within the test script.
- Output for test scripts should be to stdout.
item.summary: Consistent logging for Latte Ruby code

item.title: [TLPORTAL-160] Configuration file should be a runtime startup parameter.
item.description:
The location and filename of the Latte initial configuration file is limited to one of two hard coded choices. It should be possible to modify this by supplying an option on app startup that will contain a file path.

TESTPLAN
The runtime option specifying the configuration file location will be modified to point to files that have different contents. At least one of those should be an arbitrary location outside of the install and user home directories. To tell if the file is successfully read the contents of the files in different locations should be different. Changing the value of "invalid_query_text" should be sufficient to be able to determine which file is being read.
item.summary: Configuration file should be a runtime startup parameter.

item.title: [TLPORTAL-163] Create installation file mapping file
item.description:
For application deployment in testing and production environments there needs to be a mechanism to select application configuration files without modifying the application build artifacts. A "configuration mapping" file in the format described below will be recognized by the AWI installation procedure and needs to be supplied for the Latte application.

Part of the build artifacts provided for T&L applications are sets of configuration files that provide information which the applications depend on. The build provides all the configuration files for all the different instances of the application.

To ease future installations a new "configuration mapping" file will be supplied that specifies the mapping between a symbolic link and physical files. The application can depend on a symbolic link with a consistent name which will be pointing to the appropriate file. The mapping file will make sure that the link will point to the specific file for the specific selected configuration.

Lines in the configuration map will structured as follows.
[configuration_name] <symbolic link name> <physical file name>

When the file processed for installation a specific configuration_name will be specified. Only lines that match that name will be used. All other lines will be ignored. Lines starting with an '#' will always be ignored. E.g. for the QA-LOADTEST configuration a line might be:
[QA-LOADTEST] studentdashboard.yml studentdashboard-QA-LOADTEST.yml

The symbolic and physical name values matching a particular configuration will be extracted from a line and used by the installation script to generate a symbolic link. If a file name is specified with an absolute path the value will not be modified. If the name is a relative path it will have the SYMLINK_PREFIX (or INSTALL_PREFIX) environment variable prepended to it. If those variables are not defined the variable value will default to './'.
item.summary: Create installation file mapping file

comments.comment: Write up in Footprints and close

item.title: [TLPORTAL-169] Review the APIs for assessments and assignments in CTools and Canvas
item.description:
Based on student feedback from polls, surveys and 1-1 sessions it's apparent that there's a need for students to see the course schedule and related assignments and quizzes with due dates.

We want to review the APIs for assignments and quizzes to better understand the data we are able to collect on a student. This will help determine what options we can offer students for viewing this data on Latte. For example, are assignments weighted in value other than by points, priorities for quizzes, etc. This will help determine the need for a drop-down feature for viewing categories of assignments and quizzes.

We also want to analyze the data generated from CTools and Canvas sites that could be useful for students on Latte. Four sub-tasks are included in this Jira for that effort.

Acceptance Criteria: After analyzing the data from the 4 sub-tasks, Document a list of 'interesting' APIs that will drive Phase 2 functionality.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1sYcbntRTqnd5oqwt3Bbp8ioHw7ACwj25XAYtcWlB1cY/edit#
item.summary: Review the APIs for assessments and assignments in CTools and Canvas

comments.comment:
Cathy and Chris will create test sites in Canvas and CTools that will incorporate the use cases for students use of Assignments and Quizzes. The related jiras are included in this ticket.

The link for the Canvas API Documentation: https://canvas.instructure.com/doc/api/index.html
We'll close this when we review the Phase II requirements

These situations will be handled but not logged. The effort to determine the cause exceeds the benefit given this is a minor bug.

TESTPLAN

item.title: [TLPORTAL-172] Student Dashboard application should return a 403 code instead of 401 if an authorized user attempts to use the uniqname parameter.
item.description:
When a user not part of the Admin MCommunity group attempts to utlize the uniqname parameter to retrieve someone else's schedule. The response code should be 403 (forbidden) rather than 401 (unauthorized).

See for a discussion of the topic: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3297048/403-forbidden-vs-401-unauthorized-http-responses
item.summary: Student Dashboard application should return a 403 code instead of 401 if an authorized user attempts to use the uniqname parameter.

item.title: [TLPORTAL-181] Ensure that data elements that should be in an array for the UI are actually presented to the UI in an array.
item.description:
Some data returned from the Student Dashboard ESB API consists of lists. E.g lists of instructors or classes or terms. The actual JSON data format returned depends on the number of elements that might appear in the list. When there are no elements nothing or an empty object is returned. If there is a single element for the list that is returned as that single object. If there are more elements then they are returned in a list.

The StudentDashboard / Latte backend should ensure that this issue doesn't surface for the UI and should make sure that those data elements are returned as JSON lists regardless of the number of elements that would be in the list.
item.summary: Ensure that data elements that should be in an array for the UI are actually presented to the UI in an array.

comments.comment: If TLPORTAL-150 is resolved, then this JIRA can be closed as unnecessary

Latte implements a REST server for getting course and term data from the ESB. The courses call should require an explicit termid since the default is not stated and may be misleading.

This can make system debugging / verification difficult since it is easy to retrieve incorrect information.

item.description: The Latte data providers compute the provider to use with each request. A side effect of this is that the logs are littered with statements specifying which provider has been used.

item.title: [TLPORTAL-206] User should be shown an error page when there is a user permissions error

The user should get an indication there has been a permissions error. I.e. if they ask for data for someone else they should see a page with a useful message rather than a blank page.

item.title: [TLPORTAL-208] Update of MCommunity admin users list should not require restarting Latte.
item.description:
Currently the list of Admin user is read from MCommunity on startup and changes require an application restart. The list of admin users should be updated dynamically.

Test plan updated. Separate testplans are required for local host testing and QA testing.

TESTPLAN LOCALHOST
- modify the value of cache_seconds in server/local/ldap.yml to be 10 seconds
- ensure that authn_uniqname_override is set to false in the studentdashboard.yml file.
- ensure that the latte_admin_group is set to TL-Latte-admin-test.
- set default user to be one of the members of the latte_admin_group group.
- bring up latte
- Go to localhost:3000. Verify that the user name at the bottom is the default user.
- Try URL localhost:3000/?UNIQNAME=RALT and ensure that get term and class list.
- Try URL localhost:3000/?UNIQNAME=HOWDY. Ensure that get a blank screen.
- remove the default user from the TL-Latte-admin-test group. Do NOT restart latte.
- empty cache and restart browser.
- wait at least 10 seconds and try to use the UNIQNAME query parameter again. Try the 3 URLs above again. The first should work. Neither the second or third should return data.
- Return the default user to the TL-Latte-admin-test group. Make sure they have the member role in the group.
- Wait at least 10 seconds
- The 3 URLS above should work again.

TESTPLAN QA
This will require working with two uniqnames. Both must be added to the MCommunity group TL-Latte-admin-test. At least one must be a group owner in order to modify the MCommunity group.
1) Ensure QA has the uniqname_override set to false in the active studentdashboard.yml file.
2) Empty cache and restart browser.
3) Go to https://sd-tl-qa.it.umich.edu/StudentDashboard/. Cosign authenticate as a user in the TL-Latte-admin-test group. You should see the user's term and course data. For non-students there will be no data and the screen should say something to that effect.
4) Verify that visiting URL https://sd-tl-qa.it.umich.edu/StudentDashboard/?UNIQNAME=RALT returns term and class data.
5) Use second, group owner, Uniqname to remove current user from the TL-Latte-admin-test group. (Do not restart Latte.)
6) Wait 5 minutes.
7) Empty the cache and restart the browser.
8) Go to https://sd-tl-qa.it.umich.edu/StudentDashboard/. Cosign authenticate as the same user as before. You should see the same information for this user as before.
9) Verify that visiting URL https://sd-tl-qa.it.umich.edu/StudentDashboard/?UNIQNAME=RALT does NOT return term and course data. It should return an empty screen.
10) Use the owner uniqname to add the current user back into the TL-Latte-admin-test group. Ensure the returned user has the member role in the group.
11) Repeat steps 2, 3, and 4. They should have the same results as the first time.
item.summary: Update of MCommunity admin users list should not require restarting Latte.

comments.comment: Issue with not removing deleted MCommunity Admin group members was fixed in github PR 156.

item.title: [TLPORTAL-214] Error in log when user has no courses
item.description:
If the ESB returns no courses for a user an error is written to the latte log. This should be caught and handled by returning an appropriate json response to the UI.

Some queries to the ESB will have no corresponding data to return. These results are returned in various ways from in the ESB json. The ESB provider should recognize the
different responses and return a standard result of an empty list. It should also trap errors that could come from malformed JSON returned from the ESB and return an error status.


TESTPLAN

- Verify that a user with a valid uniqname and courses works as expected.
- Verify that a user with a valid uniqname and no courses does not print a stack trace in the log and displays an "no courses found" message in the UI.
- Verify that a user with an invalid uniqname does not cause a raw stack trace in the log and displays an "unable to process" message in the UI. The log should contain informative error messages describing what issue was encountered. Those log message may contain a wrapped stack trace.
item.summary: Error in log when user has no courses

comments.comment: The same code change will address both issues.

So what is the servlet returning if so? At present?

Options by order of preference:

1. httpStatus signals a problem via a real or bogus code. Front end does no processing, just plugs message in Meta object into the appropriate receptacle. Result set is an empty array.

{
  "Meta": {
    "httpStatus": XXX,
    "Message": "No courses found for this term."
  },
  "Result": []
}

2. Front end sees an empty array and makes a guess as to what it means and plugs a message of it's own in the the above-mentioned receptacle.

The back end will return:
- data if the ESB returns valid data.
- An empty array if the ESB runs the request successfully but does not have data to return.
- A metastatus of 666 if there is an error interpreting the results of the request to the ESB.

The backend doesn't know what should be displayed to the user. It can only document what happened when the request was processed. The front end behavior should not rely on text provided by the back end.
That makes perfect sense, thanks.
I cannot test this with ESB QA currently as it is returning an array with a single null value if no instructors, crashing the UI.

item.description:

Errors

Angular vs JQuery

Presentation

Project Structure

move services and factories into /services and /factories folders
move filters into /filters folder
item.summary: UI Technical Debt Phase 1

item.title: [TLPORTAL-221] Leverage Splunk for analytics on Latte usage and generate reports
item.description:
We want to monitor how Latte is being consumed by users. It would be helpful to track the following usage data:
1. How many logins to Latte per day/week? (Are they going there throughout the term or just the first few weeks?)
2. How many of those users click on a course link. (This will give us an idea of how many instructors/staff login to Latte.)
3. The time of day when usage is highest. (optional)
4. The day of week when usage is highest. (optional)


Latte logs are currently available in Splunk. The retention period is 3 months so summary tables would need to be generated to keep data beyond that point. Reports can be run that will will, most likely, be able to answer the 4 questions above though question 2 may be difficult. Someone will need to take time to: understand Splunk, write and test reports, and create summary tables on an on-going basis.


EMAIL from Brian Awood.

---------

Dave,
Our default retention time is 6 months. However, there is a couple of
ways to retain summarized data longer and make reports run more
efficiently.
http://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/6.2.1/Knowledge/Aboutsummaryindexing
if there is a need, we can create a summary index for ctools data.

As far as including multiple sources/hosts in your searches, you can
tag things to make it easier/cleaner.
http://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/6.2.1/Knowledge/Abouttagsandaliases

---------

Sorry, I just realized as I sent that message that our default is 3
months for regular data and 6 months for security related and HIPAA
data.
item.summary: Leverage Splunk for analytics on Latte usage and generate reports

comments.comment:
The following query will produce a count of the people accessing Latte so clearly the logs are being indexed. This particular query is more specific than it should be.

index=* host=skylark* NOT snmpd source="/usr/local/ctools/apache/logs/20150504-access_log" NOT "/ctadmin-jsp/freeMem" NOT "/StudentDashboard/check" NOT username="-" "/StudentDashboard/courses" | stats count by username

This query looks at multiple hosts and log files and returns more results.

index=* host=skylark* OR host=somerset* NOT snmpd source="/usr/local/ctools/apache/logs/*" NOT "/ctadmin-jsp/freeMem" NOT "/StudentDashboard/check" NOT username="-" "/StudentDashboard/courses" | stats count by username
Assign to someone in ISO

item.title: [TLPORTAL-230] Specify persistent user for StudentDashboard in the security.yml file.
item.description:
There is a "check" url in studentdashboard that allows for ongoing checks of system liveness by EUE and Nagios. This requires configuration of a user name and term. An existing user should be specified for the user and term. For non-test versions of StudentDashboard the user should be specified in the security.yml file. Currently the user is specified in the studentdashboard.yml file.

To implement this each data provider should add a new "check" call that is only responsible for implementing check call to ensure liveness. Configuration of the data provider will supply the values for the check call. The file provider will use the "default" user. The ESB provider will use the data from the application information in the security.yml file. Each application in the security.yml file should have the check_uniqname and check_termid specified. They may vary by the specific ESB application configuration.

TESTPLAN

Disk based provider:
- activate the disk-based provider by uncommenting the data_provider_file_directory line in the effective studentdashboard.yml file.
- ensure that the <server>/check URL returns a page an ok value and that the log file doesn't show errors.
- hide the file test-files/terms/default.json and restart the local latte server.
- ensure that the <server>/check URL returns a page that says "NOT OK". The server log should show messages with a 404 status code for the "default.json" file.

ESB based provider.
- Ensure that the data_provider_file_directory in the effective studentdashboard.yml file is commented out and the server has been restarted.
- verify security.yml that the value for the check_uniqname and check_term as set to a valid user for the ESB instance / ESB application that will be used for testing.
- The <server>/check URL should return a page with OK and a 200 status code. There should be a URL in the log that matches the specified check values. The url will look like: "/Students/ststvii/Terms/2010/Schedule" but with the uniqname and term specified in the security.yml file. There should not be associated errors in log. A '401' error with 'Access token inactive' is ok.
- Modify security.yml to change the uniquename to an uniqname for someone that doesn't exist.
- The <server>/check url should return a 500 status code. The status value on the page should be "NOT OK". The log should contain error messages reporting bad data.
- Modify the check values in security.yml to use a uniqname for a valid user with no classes and restart the server.
- The <server>/check url should return a 500 status code. The status value on the page should be "NOT OK". The log should contain error messages reporting bad data.
item.summary: Specify persistent user for StudentDashboard in the security.yml file.

item.title: [TLPSO-180] Import of Test Center content to new site results in corrupted Questions
item.description:
Instructor imports Test Center content into a new site in preparation for next term but after the import, a check of the questions in the pool shows that many of the imported questions are corrupt and unusable. Copying a site has the same result, questions are not accurately recreated on the copied site. An email from the instructor is included below - two screenshots are attached that show the answer given for the question on the original; site and the answer for the same question on the copied site:

======

Jeff,

I randomly checked the Test Center of "Copy 1 of EECS 314 Spring"
and found kind of familiar flaws:

In Pool: pc_TransferFunction
(this is on filter circuits, every Question should include circuit diagrams)

Question 1 is clean:
you can see circuit diagrams A-E evidently created from the same template
but
Question 2 is corrupt:
choice A does not have any diagram (although it should, as in Q1);
instead, it includes an apparently distorted image of a text about ammeters;
other choices are correct, comparable to Question 1.

For comparison, I went to the original EECS 314 CTools web site for Spring 2014 and took a screenshot of the same Question 2 choice A (good, as expected)
side to side with the screenshot of Copy 1, which you created
- - - please see both attached.
======

It would be helpful for a developer to take a look to see if they can tell what is happening here. The issue may be confined to the questions/pools created for this class as I have seen no other reports of this same problem from other users. However, this instructor's course is constructed around extensive use of Test Center and he may need to re-design his course if we can't fix this for him.

I have been working extensively with this instructor to investigate and mitigate this issue. He has been addressing this situation by manually correcting the corrupted questions but this is quite labor intensive so it would be good if we can find a solution or workaround before next term. Otherwise he will need to once again recreate all questions for his site or re-use his current course site where he is correcting the question, which is not recommended and will create additional problems with managing student-added content.

Class: EECS 314 001
Incident# INC0280294
Original site for Spring 2014: a5faa2cd-268d-42e3-b400-b08506bcec38
Copy of the Spring 2014 site (with corrupted questions copied): 6d1324cd-eeab-4fe0-a217-61cbd542bf0c

There are a couple of other sites involved in the same situation. The site he is currently using to teach his class for Fall 2014 (with questions corrupted when imported from the Spring site) and a Repository site where he is working on correcting questions that were imported from both the Fall site and the original Spring 14 site. I've linked the repository site to the Fall site so the students can take their assessments on that site.

Fall 2014 site: 492c7f9e-a190-4873-baca-b2e0cbf905ee
Repository site: 431dde1b-d90d-4dc7-a485-292af75dbeed
item.summary: Import of Test Center content to new site results in corrupted Questions

comments.comment:
We've noted problems with Test Center QTI export/import not working at all in https://jira.sakaiproject.org/browse/UMICH-1120

The QTI export is a new feature that is non-compliant and has many problems.
We can look into site-copy problem to see if that might have more promise.

This is not a QTI import problem AFAIK, this happens when the Test Center content is imported through Site Info->Import from Site OR when the site is duplicated just as we would do for any other Sakai tool. My guess is that the same function is called for either of those cases, but my understanding is that QTI import/export is a completely separate function based on an interoperability standard and is intended mainly to move content to another instance or other compliant delivery system. Actually I considered using QTI as a workaround but did not pursue after noticing the traffic related to the QTI issue - wanted to avoid using another unreliable function.

Have you tried this suggestion from Etudes?
 
1. Click on Import in Mneme.
2. Select Import from AT&S.
3. Select a site and click on OK at the bottom.
4. Select the assessment(s) to copy and click on OK.

I imported know good Test Center assessments/pools using the QTI import method suggested and asked the instructor to check the validity of this import method. The first question he checked had the error so this method is equal or worse than the other methods that I've tested.

We still need more information on what triggers the problem for this site, since it's not generally reproducible for all sites. If we can setup a site in CTQA that demonstrates the problem, then we'd be closer to tracking down the root cause.

item.title: [TLPSO-194] CTStats - modify landing page so a single page will work for production and non-production servers
item.description:
Currently separate copies of index.html are required for the production and non-production CTStats servers. This increases maintenance time and makes mistakes more likely. The page differences are minimal and a single page can be created and customized to cover the two instances.

The single page should, depending on the server, be able to display:
- different background colors,
- different text and links in some sections of the page.

These differences are used to be sure it is easy to distinguish between the instances and that text is appropriate for the instance. E.g. Links might be available on the non-production page before they are appropriate for the production page.
item.summary: CTStats - modify landing page so a single page will work for production and non-production servers

item.title: [TLQCI-146] The list of survey recipients for used for constructing student survey links should have a short term cache.
item.description:
The current Qualtrics implementation gets the full set of survey recipients each time a link needs to be constructed. Since that list doesn't change frequently this is inefficient when multiple links are being constructed at the same time. E.g. when an instructor says "take the survey now".

Suggested implementation

The list of recipients for each survey should be cached in the global Tomcat session and made available across threads. This should be a short lived cache and should not be persisted. The purpose is to cut the rate of repeated requests when there is a burst of requests in a short period of time. The payback for avoiding rare requests will be low.
item.summary: The list of survey recipients for used for constructing student survey links should have a short term cache.

Beth,

item.title: [TLUNIZIN-148] Create a utility cull unused Canvas course shells at the end of each semester
item.description:
One of the dangers with an auto-provisioning approach is the proliferation of unused course shells. One approach to solving this is deleting course shells at the end of each semester, when it can be deemed that they are unused. A utility should be created to automatically delete course shells at the end date of each term. The course shells should not published and have no content. Specifically, the course should not have any of the following:
    - Announcements (cannot find this in the api?)
    - Assignments
    - Chat
    - Conferences
    - Collaborations (assuming collaborations are linked to a course?)
    - Discussion topics
    - Files
    - Grade changes
    - Groups from a course
    - Modules
    - Pages
    - Quizzes
    - Syllabus (cannot find this in the api?)
    - Added external tools
item.summary: Create a utility cull unused Canvas course shells at the end of each semester

item.title: [TLUNIZIN-392] Modify SIS Upload process to create sandbox courses for all instructors
item.description:
We would like to ensure that all instructors and relevant support staff will have a practice site to work on in Canvas. Beth and Chris had a conversation about this on 2/12/2015 and decided the best way to do this was to modify the SIS upload process to:

- Get a list of Teachers, TAs, Librarians and Designers sent in the current file
- Verify whether these people have an existing Canvas sandbox
- Create one if they do not already have one. As the process will recreate these sites if they are deleted, language should be included to indicate this.

The sandboxes should be called "{full name}'s Practice Course", should exist in the default term in a sub-account called 'Practice Courses'. Previously, sandbox courses were created using the naming convention 'A Canvas training course for {uniqname}'. These existing courses should either be:

- Part of the verification process
- Modified to use the new naming standard in the new sub-account.
item.summary: Modify SIS Upload process to create sandbox courses for all instructors

comments.comment:
[~ckretler][~zqian] 2 questions on this:
1. would we ever receive Librarians or Designers from SIS? I thought these were added manually
2. is this something that you think we would be adding with SIS Phase 3? Or deploy after March 23rd? I want to make sure that I track timing of when we think this could be worked on and overall priority...i.e. it would be nice for this to be available when we begin training sessions in April, but we may have to do a workaround until this can be completed.

We do not currently receive those roles from the SIS. It is feasible with the incorporation of MCommunity data that this will change, but that is aspirational at this point. The goal of this proposed solution is to handle the 80% bulk of these requests. The rest would need to be handled manually.

Code merged in after code review.

The new feature will:

1. check all active teach-role user in every SIS upload
2. verify if there is existing Sandbox site for the user or not
3. create the Canvas sandbox site for the user

item.title: [TLUNIZIN-431] Initial demand management planning for possible scanned exams LS&A project
item.summary: Initial demand management planning for possible scanned exams LS&A project

comments.comment:
Per demonner, they have what they need for an initial conversation at this point; no additional action needed.

Issues include:

1. Could images be stored in ImageNow or Canvas? If ImageNow, is 2-factor authentication required? How could we get around that? Is ImageNow LTI compatible? How could ImageNow be used to have individual file access be restricted to a student and whomever is an instructor or Canvas admin (could change over time)? If Canvas, LTI tool would have to copy files to Canvas space and have it count as an assignment submission for that individual student in order for permissions to work -- couldn't push grade though.
2. Suspect imaging service (scanning) couldn't handle bluebooks themselves -- dealbreaker for faculty? Or could they handle them at some additional cost?
3. Cost model for scanning conversion even after service developed -- if pushed to schools/colleges would they adopt service?
4. What do others on campus do with this issue? E.g., AST or Admissions -- what do they do with artefacts that are born on paper? Do they insist on digital conversion before acceptance?

From Mandi Grabowski (BSA working with ImageNow on Content Management Team):

Hi Victoria,

The short answer is yes, it is possible to integrate with learning management software.

The long answer is that ImageNow provides options for system to system integration in a couple of ways. It can be through a web services call or a dynamic URL. You can link from a page to a specific document or folder within Imaging so that it can be viewed, copied or deleted.

We currently have system to system integrations with PeopleSoft, FileMaker (at the School of Music), DART and the Provost Info System. We're currently working on a project to create an API Directory for Imaging, but we are looking at this fall for that to be implemented.

I'm happy to discuss things further with you. Would it be easier to chat in person? I'm also in ASB.

Please let me know when you're available.

Thanks,
Mandy

Simplest solution to start with could be to use imaging service to scan and index student papers/exams and to make them visible to instructors/admin staff only. Paper copies could then be returned to students (or shredded if instructor doesn't want to share them). Wouldn't be accessible through Canvas or other LMS and instructors would still have to hand out paper copies if they wanted students to have access but could be an initial test to see if scanning turnaround times and accuracy are acceptable.

It's also possible that some units already do this.
3/17/15 -- needs to be captured in PV

item.title: [TLUNIZIN-471] Update ServiceLink Integration to Service Cloud for Instructure Ticketing
item.description:
Here’s what you can expect:
 
March 1 - April 30
We’ll work with a partner to customize the Service Cloud platform to satisfy all existing Zendesk workflows
May 1 (or earlier)
We’ll send training materials (including videos and a training course) to all of you
June 1 (or earlier)
You’ll have the opportunity to take the new system for a test drive
June 1 - June 15
You can let your CSM know if you want to use your own ticketing system rather than Service Cloud so we can test the integration and workflow with your team (see below*)
June 16 - June 18
We’ll present informational sessions at InstructureCon about Service Cloud
June 26
We’ll migrate all existing tickets to Service Cloud
June 27
We’ll start handling all new support requests in Service Cloud
 
*About using your own ticketing system:
 
We know many of you would rather work in your institution’s own ticketing system of choice than any system we might provide. So we’re adding a feature to Canvas that will enable it to send a specially-formatted email to your ticketing system rather than to Service Cloud when one of your users submits a request. Email-to-ticket is a feature of all major ticketing systems. You’ll be able to tinker with this feature prior to Go Live so you can decide which approach you’d rather take.
We’ll expand this feature to include direct API connections to your own Service Cloud or Zendesk systems later this fall.
If you opt to route your tickets to your own ticketing system, you’d escalate tickets to the Canvas team through Service Cloud, when necessary.
item.summary: Update ServiceLink Integration to Service Cloud for Instructure Ticketing

comments.comment: Per Barrett - Instructure may be migrating our triggers and logic to send to ServiceLink for us. On hold until we confirm whether any changes in ServiceLink are required.

item.title: [TLUNIZIN-473] Migrate all support materials links to new Canvas Community Guides
item.description:
See more details here....we will need to validate and repoint all Canvas Guides links it would seem during May and June.

https://help.instructure.com/entries/63442704-Canvas-Community-2-0-FAQs


When will the old community officially go away?
The transition will happen in phases:
[April 1, 2015] The old “Feature Discussions” area will be view-only. No more new requests.
[April 15, 2015] The entire old community will be view-only. No more posts, comments, votes, subscriptions.
[June 30, 2015] The entire old community will disappear. (This is the actual end-date of our old community platform contract.) Note that the old and the new will overlap by a couple of months, so it’ll be easy to move things you’d like preserved over before 6/30/2015.
item.summary: Migrate all support materials links to new Canvas Community Guides

comments.comment: [~sutton][~mwagner]I may have jumped the gun. Barrett told us today that it is possible the links may not all change. I will put this in my name and assign back to Margaret once I confirm that we do need to fully validate and review all Guides links.

Confirmed by Barrett that these links will need to change. New community is available starting 4/15/15

Request:
Modules and Training docs point to guides, can Support/Commies provide a little clarity/context on how the new JIVE community transition will impact this:

What will happen to all the permalinks to all the Canvas Guides?
We realize many of you link to or embed our Canvas Guides in various places. Our guides will be integrated into Community, which will give you a lot more options to share, link, bookmark, like, rate, and comment. Unfortunately, this change will also result in existing links to specific guide articles eventually breaking—link transitions will follow the same schedule as the Community transition mentioned in the previous paragraph (direct video links from Vimeo will not be affected). Again, you won't need to work on relinking your content right away, but note that redirects will only be available until the end of June. We realize that relinking specific guide articles from the new site will constitute a lot of work for people with many links but think the benefits of combining all the community resources into one site make this worthwhile.

There is additional information that might provide some insight in the Community FAQ about this move~
Assigned to Jen until Instructure confirms timeline when the old guides will no longer be updated

item.title: [TLUNIZIN-539] SUT: 'Add other sections' and 'Search for courses' should be hidden from non-admin users
item.description:
One of the steps necessary to prepare the SUT for LTI placement is to hide administrative features from non-admin users.

The two functions listed in this jira allow users to add sections from courses that are taught by another instructor or with no instructor of record listed. As such, these should be hidden from the UI if the current user is not an administrator (part of the its-canvas-sections group).

Question: would it be easier to recognize that the user is accessing the tool via LTI and simply hide them for all LTI users?
item.summary: SUT: 'Add other sections' and 'Search for courses' should be hidden from non-admin users

item.title: [TLUNIZIN-541] SUT: Rename functionality should be hidden from non-admin users
item.description:
One of the steps necessary to prepare the SUT for LTI placement is to hide administrative features from non-admin users.

The ability to rename a course should be an admininistrative feature. This is historical precedent with CTools. It ensures courses will adhere to a common naming scheme.

Question: would it be easier to recognize that the user is accessing the tool via LTI and simply hide them for all LTI users?
item.summary: SUT: Rename functionality should be hidden from non-admin users

item.title: [TLUNIZIN-542] SUT: Hide uniqname lookup screen for LTI users
item.description:
LTI users will have their identity sent via LTI. As such, the SUT should read this information and present it without the user having to add their uniqname.

The information should be sent in such a way that users cannot spoof the request via browser tools, modify for a different uniqname, and resend to look up another user's courses.

The ability to lookup a uniqname should still be available for admin (non-LTI users).
item.summary: SUT: Hide uniqname lookup screen for LTI users

item.title: [TLUNIZIN-548] Incorporate Canvas data import errors into logs/communication stream
item.description:
The current SIS import process verifies whether the process of uploading the file was successful. Information about the status of imported data is also available via the API. Please see snippet below for detail. If the import job contains a workflow_state of 'imported_with_messages', the 'processing_warnings' should be snipped out, made pretty, and reported.

{"created_at":"2015-04-27T19:00:04Z","started_at":"2015-04-27T19:00:04Z","ended_at":"2015-04-27T19:06:29Z","updated_at":"2015-04-27T19:06:29Z","progress":100,"id":429,"workflow_state":"imported_with_messages","data":{"import_type":"instructure_csv","supplied_batches":["course","section","user","enrollment"],"counts":{"accounts":0,"terms":0,"abstract_courses":0,"courses":488,"sections":488,"xlists":0,"users":606,"enrollments":1178,"groups":0,"group_memberships":0,"grade_publishing_results":0}},"batch_mode":null,"batch_mode_term_id":null,"override_sis_stickiness":null,"add_sis_stickiness":null,"clear_sis_stickiness":null,"diffing_data_set_identifier":null,"diffed_against_import_id":null,"processing_warnings":[["users.csv","No login_id given for user 67102976"],["enrollments.csv","User 67102976 didn't exist for user enrollment"],["enrollments.csv","User 67102976 didn't exist for user enrollment"],["enrollments.csv","User 67102976 didn't exist for user enrollment"]]}
item.summary: Incorporate Canvas data import errors into logs/communication stream

item.title: [TLUNIZIN-549] Only send email when import process or data imported displays an error. Otherwise log only.
item.description:
The current SIS import job sends email each time it completes. The suggestion here is to only send email if the file fails to import successfully, or if the workflow_state of the completed job is 'imported_with_messages'. This will reduce the flow of email traffic and make it more likely that errors will be noticed.

Please see TLUNIZIN-548 for more detail.
item.summary: Only send email when import process or data imported displays an error. Otherwise log only.

comments.comment:
I think you were talking about the cron daemon emails sent after every cron job finishes. I checked with Becky in the past on who are the recipients, and here is her answer:

"These emails are being sent to a Mcommunity group email called
canvas-sis-data-alerts@umich.edu

Currently these people are the owners
Jennifer Swaney, Chris Kretler, Jeffrey Cousineau,Zhen Qian

Drew, Rick, Becky and Jennifer and Chris and Jeff C, Zhen are members.
"
So I guess either one could filter out the cron mails, or ask opts team to remove the canvas-sis-data-alerts from the recipient list of cron tab.

However, when there is a real error, the email is different with this subject line: "<canvas server> Upload Error", and it is sent from ctupload@<caprice or monza>.dsc.umich.edu to the same group - "canvas-sis-data-alerts@umich.edu"
Assign this back to Chris for further directions.

The idea behind this jira was to discontinue email unless there was an error. TLUNIZIN-548 talks about incorporating data-related errors into the reporting stream, including email. Once this is done, the number of error-related email will increase greatly. We should discontinue the production of email that does not have any type of error associated with it.

item.title: [TLUNIZIN-553] Create User Interface for Friend Accounts in Canvas
item.description: Add friend account panel
item.summary: Create User Interface for Friend Accounts in Canvas

comments.comment:
Extend/Refactor Section Management Tool to create front end for Friend Account Management. The Section Management and Friend Account Management should be separate tabs on a single HTML page.

Friend Account user interface should include data entry for:
1. Friend email
2. Friend's first and last name
3. Instructors uniqname
4. Course subject, id, term and section
     a. Would be good if user could enter course subject and id and have user interface display available sections for multiple selection
     b. All sections for a canvas course should be displayed ideally, even if instructor is not the instructor of record for all these sections (but is the instructor of record for at least one section). Valid configurable roles are Teacher, TA, Designer (this can be verified at either front or backend) -- alternatively, verify that instructor has "Add/remove students for the course" permission for at least one section.

Once user hits "submit" they should get a response indicating that:

1. The request failed and why
2. The friend account exists, and the user account has been created, and the user has been added to the sections
3. The friend account needs to be created, and the user has been added to the sections
4. The friend accounts exists, the user account exists, and the user has been added to the sections

API PARAMETERS


Who determines user role? User
Who determines if the enrollment is limited to a section? What section? User
Who determines the enrollment state? Invited
Who determines self_enrolled status? Always False
Who determines notification? We do (not Canvas)
vkg -- Limit privileges to section for TA? enrollment[limit_privileges_to_course_section YES -- user would use UI to modify.


Note: api to see if a user exists that does not depend on the system IDs:

https://umich.test.instructure.com/api/v1/accounts/self/users?search_term=instx

returns

while(1);[{"id":208,"name":"instx test","sortable_name":"test, instx","short_name":"instx test","sis_user_id":"99441791","integration_id":null,"sis_login_id":"instx","login_id":"instx"}]

not documented in the Canvas API documentation that I could see.

item.title: [TLUNIZIN-559] Create backend for Friend Account Management
item.description:
Create server-side APIs to handle user interface requests as described by TLUNIZIN-558:

1. Respond to request to list sections within a course subject, id and term in Canvas - this will be done via existing proxy (updating configuration)
2. Check if a friend account exists (affects which email is sent)
3. Check if a Canvas user account exists, if not, create canvas user with email, first/last name, SIS-ID (email), login-id (email; @ replaced with +)
4. Send email to friend user and instructor indicating that either:
    a. they need to create a friend account, and they've been added to a canvas course site (with URL)
    b. they have been added to a canvas course site (with URL)

Log all actions in log file.

Test cases include:
1. The request failed
2. The friend account exists, and the user account has been created, and the user has been added to the sections
3. The friend account needs to be created, and the user has been added to the sections
4. The friend accounts exists, the user account exists, and the user has been added to the sections
item.summary: Create backend for Friend Account Management

item.title: [TLUNIZIN-562] Courses cross linked by section management tool
item.description: Using the Section Management tool to coalesce course sections where the same person is TA in one and Teacher in the other seems to cause an issue on the Canvas side. The target course is: HISTORY 349 001 FA 2015, SIS ID: 206004594301001. This was consolidated with: HISTORY 349 002, 003 and LACS 349 001, 002 and 003. The person listed as Teacher in section 1 of these courses is listed as a TA in sections 2 and 3 of both. After the enrollments were merged with the tool, the individual is now listed as both Teacher and TA in the consolidated course. As a result, the user now sees the course listed twice on their drop-down list of Canvas courses: once for each role. This was corrected by removing her TA role from the course. Doing so also removed her Teacher role, which then had to be restored. For the moment, there is no problem. We should look into making the tool transfer only the single role of Teacher in this situation.
item.summary: Courses cross linked by section management tool

item.title: [TLUNIZIN-563] Create knowledge article for Service Center on handling access to cross listed courses in Canvas
item.description:
Create knowledge article for Service Center on handling access to cross listed courses in Canvas. Cross listed courses will only be accessible by sub-account admins from the home department.

Service Center needs a set of guidelines on what to tell sub-account admins that contact 4Help about this.

Options could include contacting the home department and requesting to be added as a TA or Designer on the course or determining if the home dept needs to be changed in MPathways based on which sub-account may be using more Canvas features that apply to that specific course.
item.summary: Create knowledge article for Service Center on handling access to cross listed courses in Canvas

item.title: [TLUNIZIN-564] Create Interface to Select Course Sections, add user
item.description:
For the Admin user version the departure point will be the same as the section management.


TESTING
-------------

A. Existing user

1. enter requestor uniqname
2. request sections of target course
3. select course (clicking on the + icon - this is temporary)
4. in modal: select sections in course to add user
5. input user id to add
6. enter existing user (gsilver, for instance), click on "Check"
7. user will be identified as existing (1st and last name will be provided as proof/validation)
8. "Add" button will be active.
9. dismiss modal

B. New user

(requestor and her courses already there from steps above)

1. select course (clicking on the + icon - this is temporary)
2. in modal: select sections in course to add user
3. input user id to add
4. enter non-existing user (bingo@bang.net for instance, but use your imagination)
5. user will be identified as non existing and a form will be provided, add any info needed, click on "Create User"
6. after a while "Add" button will be active.

NOTE: no users are being created. This is just a simulation! We still have to work out the details of when it gets created in Canvas, before (or better) after they have been created in Friends Account.

C. Validation

Modal should have no memory. Launch, change things (sections, roles, existing user, new user) and dismiss and relaunch - modal should always reset to default (based on what course it was launched from).

Add button should only be active if the data has been provided (at least one section selected + existing user OR at least one section selected + new user). Messages at the bottom of the modal should reflect this.
item.summary: Create Interface to Select Course Sections, add user

comments.comment: This allows adding any user (not just friend user) to a course

item.title: [TLUNIZIN-565] Create RESTful end point to check to see if a friend account exists
item.description:
Something like

POST /friendExists?id=some@emailaddress.org

response should be a json from which a "true" or a "false" can be extracted.
item.summary: Create RESTful end point to check to see if a friend account exists

item.title: [TLUNIZIN-566] Create RESTful endpoint to create friend accounts
item.description:
Something like:

POST /friendCreate?id=some@emailaddress.org&name1=Kyle&name2=Dove

Note: not sure what data is needed to create a friend account, maybe more params will be needed.

Response should be a json from which success or failure can be extracted. Bonus would be if the json represents the user when successful.

{
  "Meta": {
    "httpStatus": 200
  },
  "Result": [
    {
   "id":"some@emailaddress.org",
   "name1":"Kyle",
   "name2":"Dove"
}
item.summary: Create RESTful endpoint to create friend accounts

item.title: [TLUNIZIN-567] Create RESTful endpoint to send email to the user
item.description:
Email will be sent by the app in two circumstances.

1. Friend account exists and user has been added to requested sites
2. Friend account does not exist, account has been created and user has been added to requested sites

In both cases the end point is the same, but the message will vary.

POST /friendEmail?id=some@emailaddress.org&subject=<subject>&message=<message>

A question is whether the requestor gets a message as well.

Response is a json indicating success/failure.
item.summary: Create RESTful endpoint to send email to the user

item.title: [TSUGITXT-37] Error handling between front end, back end & ESB
item.description:
Account for errors when requesting textbook data. Errors can be returned from ESB to Server-side, and from Server-side to Client-side.

Unfortunately with CORS the error status will always be 0.

TESTING
-------------

On localhost, run the application with no network. A generic message should appear, including the offending url.
item.summary: Error handling between front end, back end & ESB

comments.comment: https://github.com/tl-its-umich-edu/textbook/pull/35

When tested with no internet connection, I got this following error:

"We asked for http://localhost:3000/api/v1/classes.json

But something happened! We are very sorry."

Could we rephrase the error message? Can the code tell the error types, e.g. network problem, wrong return data format, etc.?
See above - all we know is the URL and "0" - another argument for running everything in 3000.
Ok - will do something more formal.
